result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Katzka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$250.00 BAIL APPLIED. Balance of costs  to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No violent contact with any victim.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J Katzka

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Andrew J Katzka in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Smith requests an adjournment to allow for continued treatment..  The State does not object.  The Court grants one final adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Adjournment request filed by Attorney Smith

Defendant Andrew J Katzka in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting adjournment for his client to complete counseling. State has no objections. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Adjournment request filed by Attorney Smith; defendant in treatment.

Defendant Andrew J Katzka in court with attorney Joseph Smith.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting plea and sentencing. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Alex Katzka or  Susan Katzka as listed in the criminal complaint. If Defendant cannot post bond he shall be allowed huber baillee status for counseling
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Andrew J Katzka in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn Menden for Atty. Joseph Smith.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
